value: In the above example, if you see from do while it is printed 2 because in do while first it won’t check loop condition and it will run loop for 1 time and after a while it will check the loop condition i> 10 means 2>10 which is false. So, it will never run.
In the while loop it will check the loop condition first. It is false so it won’t execute a block of code written inside that, so that’s why it won’t print anything.
